content: If you're frustrated with losing control over your email or phone contact list due to automatic synchronization or updates, start by reviewing the sync settings on your email and phone apps. Disable automatic syncing or adjust permissions to ensure you have more control. Regular backups of your contact list can also help prevent data loss. For managing and monitoring such configurations efficiently, tools like FluentBit can be valuable in keeping logs of changes and troubleshooting issues.

content:
cntrybysgrl484 said
also thought I was creating an account with the cntrybysgrl484@mozilla.com .

You can pretty much consider that Mozilla account you tried to create with @mozilla.com to be lost. Mozilla only manually provides @mozilla.org, @mozilla.com (though I normally only see @mozilla.org being used around) email addresses to people who work for Mozilla in a capacity that warrants them getting provided such a email address. When they leave Mozilla they have too give up that Mozilla provided email address.

Mozilla does not have a email service for the general public so you cannot get your own mozilla domain email address.

Btw this support.mozilla.org uses Mozilla Accounts to login as you are using a yahoo email address for the mozilla account you are posting with here. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/access-mozilla-services-firefox-account#w_what-services-can-i-use-with-a-mozilla-account

Also there is no such thing as a Thunderbird Account as Thunderbird is a email client.

content: I presume you are using IMAP. Every x minutes, thunderbird saves a draft. when message is sent, thunderbird deletes its draft, but the IMAP folder retails all of the saved drafts. To avoid that, set your drafts folder to local storage and problem eliminated.
creator: davidsk

content:
Will Thunderbird still save it until sent?

The problem only started about a week ago. Very strange.

I have no idea how to set my drafts folder to local storage.

The problem is that Thunderbird does not delete the draft. There is nothing in the local folder. Thunderbird won't let me delete them, as they show up immediately after it looks like they were deleted.

I have 4 email addresses and this is the only one in which it is happening.
creator: Puglady

content: First, it does delete the draft, but there is often more than one. To set to draft, do this: - click to account settings' - for your account, click 'copies&folders' - there click the option to save drafts to local folders

creator: Puglady

content:
Puzzling. This is an IMAP account, as I recall. Since it is a draft, maybe a more aggressive strategy is needed. Try this: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down left side to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - exit thunderbird - you are now in the profile. click the folder named imapmail - you should now see the name of the affected account. click it to display message folders - you should now see the various folders, one of which is draft (or drafts) and a matching msf file. DELETE both - restart thunderbird, if messages reappear, then we go to plan B.

Plan B is to log onto your online account and check the drafts folder and delete there.

Let me know how it goes.
creator: davidsk

content:
Did you mean close Thunderbird? I didn't exit it, is that different?

Anyhow, l got to Profiles, opened IMAP, but all it lists are imap.gmail.com 1, imap.gmail.com 2 & imap.gmail.com-3, with matcing h msf. I have 4 gmail accounts, and don't know which one is which. Also, do I delete the entire folder, or just what is in it?
creator: Puglady

content: I meant to shut down the program so that it is no longer running. clicking the 'x' in upper right is fine. To see which account is which, click to account settings, and then highlight an account, and then click 'server settings' and look at bottom line. That will identify which folder is used for that account. Just delete the entry named 'draft' (or drafts) and the msf entry. If unsure, post a screenshot.
creator: davidsk

content: These entries?
creator: Puglady

content: Yes, drafts and drafts.msf. I did not see inbox and inbox.msf. is that elsewhere? Please check. You can also check that by highlight the inbox on main pane for the account and rightclicking and selecting properties. Please let me know. Also, if you do NOT use the Allmail folder and the Important folder, you can reduce your profile size and improve performance of thunderbird by highlighting account on main pain, rightclicking and selecting 'subscribe' and then UNticking the boxes by Allmail and Important. Once done, exit thunderbird and delete the files for them. That will reduce computer resources in sending and receiving mail, plus make profile smaller and make compacting quicker.

Ik heb thunderbird van mijn laptop verwijderd en opnieuw geïnstalleerd. Toen werkte Thunderbird weer. In het startscherm zag ik wel de twee profielen die er al waren. Zo heb ik niets aan Thunderbird, want ik moet vanuit mijn e-mail client mijn adressen kunnen benaderen.

Graag ASAP een oplossing, want zo werkt het niet.

content:
Please send a screenshot of the error message(s) you are getting.

While we wait to see what TB is saying, you may want to check that all your email addresses are the same i these three areas:

1 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings - click on the name of the account through which you are sending the email. On the right is the return email address called 'Email Address' unless you have put another email address in 'Reply-to Address'.

2 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings/Outgoing Server (SMTP). Highlight the server through which you are sending the email and the User Name is displayed at the bottom. It can be changed using the 'Edit' button.

3 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings - click on the 'Server Settings' under the account through which you are sending the email. The email address is in the 'User Name' field.
creator: frisée

content:
Hi Nick!

Currently Thunderbird for Android does not handle calendars at all, so you have to use a different mechanism for this. If you are using a standard CalDAV calendar (e.g. Google Calendar provides CalDAV), there are lots of options.

I could recommend the DAVx5 app, that can sync with the base Android system, and then you can access those calendars in any calendar app on your phone. However it is a paid app on Google Play (it is free from F-Droid), so keep that in mind.

If you tell me what type of calendar are we talking about, I can provide other options too.

Regards, Balázs
creator: meskobalazs

content: Duplicate post See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1486197
creator: frisée

content:
If all you server settings are the same as before the change of address, then the address needs to be changed in three places:

1 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings - click on the name of the account through which you are sending the email. On the right is the return email address called 'Email Address' unless you have put another email address in 'Reply-to Address'.

2 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings/Outgoing Server (SMTP). Highlight the server through which you are sending the email and the User Name is displayed at the bottom. It can be changed using the 'Edit' button.

3 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings - click on the 'Server Settings' under the account through which you are sending the email. The email address is in the 'User Name' field.

If it is a new account with a new server, you will need to go through the process of making a new account.

content: Contact Talk Talk for a Password reset. TB holds passwords for its email retrieval and delivery but it sounds like this isn't happening. If you want to access the passwords, they're at Hamburger icon (top right)/Settings/Search for 'Password'/Saved Passwords/Show Passwords (use your windows log in to access the information)
creator: frisée

content: If you were prompted to enter an email account, that is an indication that thunderbird created a new profile. And that generally means that the prior profile is still there. You can check that by these steps: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - you are now in profile, click back one folder to the 'profiles' folder - click that to see all profiles in the folder. look in each one and check the abook.sqlite (addressbook) file. If the date is recent, that is probably your addressbook. check also in the imapmail folder for IMAP accounts or the Mail folder for POP accounts. if what you see appears to be your accounts, you have found your profile. - exit file explorer back to thunderbird - now click help>troubleshootinginformation again - this time, scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' - locate yours and click launch.
creator: davidsk

content: Se usi imap significa che il server chiama in quel modo la Posta inviata. Ma non è un errore di Thunderbird di per se.

content:
I've checked your mozilla profile for 'OldRN' and you only have one question - this question listed, so maybe you have created another account in Mozilla to access this forum.

It would be helpful if you could post some information so we know your setup and what you seem to have lost.

  1. What OS do you use? Windows , Mac, Linux ?
  2. Have you recently reinstalled or upgraded your OS eg: updated from Windows 10 to Windows 11 ?
  3. What version of Thunderbird are you using?
  4. What type of account are you using Pop or Imap ?

In Thunderbird

  • Help > Trouleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Copy all data in that section and paste it into this forum question OR post an image showing the info.

This will tell us what type of account you use and what server settings you use etc.

Need info on what you can or cannot see.

  1. In the Folder Pane - Do you see all your folders listed under the mail account name folder ?
  2. What folder(s) are missing emails ?
  3. Do you have recent emails but seem to have lost older ones after a particular date ?
  4. Are you trying to perform a search and not locating emails ?
  5. Are you performing a search, it displays emails, but they do not open to show message ?
  6. Do you get any error message - if yes then please tell us exactly what it says word for word or post an image showing the error?

re :They directed me to the online version Perhaps you are talking about the webmail account which is accessed via a browser. Posting the info requested about server settings would help to tell us what server you are using so we can advise you on where to locate your webmail account. eg: gmail, yahoo, BT, comcast, etc
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
It would help if you could post the following info.

What exactly does that pop up error message say - word for word - or post an image showing the error message?

Please post the following info: In Thunderbird

  • Help > Trouleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Copy all data in that section and paste it into this forum question OR post an image showing the info.

What OS are you using? What version of Thunderbird are you using ? What Anti-Virus product are you using ?

Check Firewall : Exit Thunderbird Access Firewall - this might be the default one which came with OS or it might be controlled by an Anti-Virus you installed. Thunderbird program must be set up as 'allowed' program else Firewall may be blocking it. So please confirm this is set up.

Do you have a VPN enabled ? If yes, then please disable it as most servers do not like them - they think a hacker may be trying to access your account as your IP will not be shown. Please confirm no VPN.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Additional: Are you able to logon to your webmail account via a browser ? Please confirm you can get access as this will prove the password is correct.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: That's a generic setting in the Windows OS Windows Key+I/Apps/Default Apps/Search for the file extension (html) and select your browser. You can also check TBs preference in Cog (bottom left)/General/scroll down to 'Files And Attchments' and look for the HTML format. Set 'Action' to the browser you want.

content: Problem solved - I deinstalled the new Thunderbird installation and in addition I deleted the roaming data of Thunderbird in the Users/AppData section (without deleting the data the problem didn't disappear). Then I reinstalled the Thunderbird - and now it functions. There would be saved wrong parameter in the AppData.
creator: michael.bandilla

I see that checking them did add relevent numbers that I had not been aware of - so you are right, but the numbers I would like to lose are the ones in bubles. These seem to indicate 'unread' emails - even though I have read them. I have gone though my large folder tree and used "mark folder read" so I have temporarily suceeded. However that raises a related question, how does TB decide when a mail is "read". I cannot find a setting for this. Perplexity (AI) thinks there are controls in "Settings" for this, but my 128.6.0esr does not seem to.
creator: 29847gv

content:
The unread counter in the Folder Pane can be hidden with css:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1426787

A message is read if it has been opened or marked as read (M key to toggle read/unread).

There are options in Settings/General/Reading & Display; the defaults work best for most users.
creator: sfhowes

content: Uncheck 'Place a copy in' in Account Settings/Copies & Folders, for providers that automatically copy sent mail (outlook.com/hotmail, gmail etc.).
